diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Ms. ___ experienced severe abdominal pain localized to the epigastrium and periumbilical area, with nausea and vomiting after a mild onset of symptoms. The presentation aligns with gallstone pancreatitis, particularly considering her family history of gallbladder disease and previous urinary tract infection treated with antibiotics. There were no signs of fever, chills, or other complications, and examination revealed mild tenderness in the abdomen.
